question:
Which among the following pairs of volcanoes is/are correctly matched?
  1. Mount Erebus - ArcticÂ 
  2. Mount Sidley - Antarctica
Select the correct code from the options given below:
explanation:
Mount Erebus is the second highest volcano in Antarctic. It is the southernmost active volcano on the Earth. It is the sixth highest ultra-mountain on the continent.

Mount Sidley is the highest dormant volcano in Antarctica. It has a summit elevation of 4285 metres. It is a member of Volcanic Seven Summits.
